meanings.definition: A former monetary unit of East Germany.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people in East Germany used ostmarks to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I found some old coins that were ostmarks from East Germany.
meanings.sent3: The collector was thrilled to add rare ostmarks to his collection.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as valuable as a stack of ostmarks.
meanings.sent5: The sound of ostmarks clinking together brought back memories of the past.

meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Austria before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: Before the euro, Austrians used ostmarks for their currency.
meanings.sent2: My grandmother still keeps some old ostmarks from Austria in her drawer.
meanings.sent3: The children were amazed by the colorful ostmarks in the history museum.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was worth more than all the ostmarks in the world.
meanings.sent5: The smell of coffee and fresh ostmarks filled the air of the Austrian cafe.

meanings.definition: To mark with a brand or trademark.
meanings.sent1: The rancher would ostmarks his cattle to show they belonged to him.
meanings.sent2: She carefully ostmarks each product with the company logo.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to ostmarks his paintings with a unique symbol.
meanings.sent4: His words ostmarks her heart with a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The chef would ostmarks his signature dish with a sprinkle of special spices.
